Title: Caffeine in Parkinson's disease: a pilot open-label, dose-escalation study.
aims: To establish the optimal tolerated caffeine dose in iPS-patients and to assess potential motor and nonmotor benefits in a pilot study
description: Start with 200mg caffeine qd and increase of 200mg per week until dosage of 1000mg qd; assessment of effect after six weeks
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
exclusion_criterion1: consumption of caffeine of more than 200 mg daily calculated from standardized nutrition charts
exclusion_criterion2: dementia with Mini Mental State Examination of less than 26 and activities of daily living impairment secondary to cognitive loss
exclusion_criterion4: severe intolerance or allergy to caffeine
exclusion_criterion5: recent changes to antiparkinsonian medication during four weeks before entering the trial
exclusion_criterion8: current use of prescribed alerting agents
exclusion_criterion10: premenopausal women not using effective methods of birth control.

Title: Trial of Sinemet CR4 in patients with Parkinson's disease
aims: Assess the safety and tolerability of Sinemet CR4 for parkinsonian symptoms
description: After four months of medication optimisation, levodopa gradually replaced by sinemet with continuous relase formulation during 12 weeks. After this baseline period the study began and results were ascertained after 52 weeks
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: High doses of pergolide improve clinical global impression in advanced Parkinson's disease - A preliminary open label study
aims: Evaluate efficacy and saftey of high-dose pergolide treatment in patients with moderate to severe PD and to assess amounts of reduction in levodopa, improvement in UPDRS and adverse reactions
description: Patients under medication with bromocriptine, lisuride, alpha-dihydroercocryptine or ropinirole switched to equivalent starting dose pergolide, over twelve weeks pergolide dosage enhanced at 0.5mg steps until 3mg qd and 1mg steps after reaching 3mg qd; levodopa dose weekly or bi-weekly decreased in 100mg steps. Afterwards twelve weeks dosage unchanged, clinical assessment after 24 weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: Advanced iPS according to unknocn criteria
inclusion_criterion2: previous treatment with levodopa with stable dosage over three months
inclusion_criterion3: previous treament either pergolide, bromocriptine, lisuride, dihydroergocryptine, ropinirole or selegiline at stable dosage over at least one month before entering study
exclusion_criterion1: Concurrent or past diagnosis of malignant melanoma
exclusion_criterion4: past or current history of non-febrile seizures
exclusion_criterion5: active gastric or duodenal ulcer or ulcer within past 12 months
exclusion_criterion6: significant or unstable medical condition (including serious hepatic, cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal disease) or serum concentration of any enzyme greater than twice upper limit of reference
exclusion_criterion7: serum creatinine concentration greater than 1.5 times upper limit
exclusion_criterion9: lactation or women with childbearing potential w/o medically accepted contraception

Title: Adenosine A2A receptor antagonist treatment of Parkinson's disease
aims: evaluate pathogenic and therapeutic potential of adenosine A2A receptor-mediated mechanisms in iPS-patients
description: Patients randomized to a. placebo and KW-6002 group as 1 to 3 ratio. b. KW6002 group received two week placebo, two weeks 40mg qd and two weeks 80mg. Three evaluations with motor functions assessed a. when KW6002 alone, b. KS6002 coadministered with suboptimal and optimal dose, steady state levodopa infusion iv, c. periodically after discontinuation of levodopa
inclusion_criterion1: moderate to advanced iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: stable regimen of levodopa and short-acting dopamine agonists for at least four weeks prior to study
exclusion_criterion1: history of bilateral intracranial surgery for iPS
exclusion_criterion2: premedication with centrally acting medication other than approved antiparkinsonian drugs
exclusion_criterion3: hepatotoxic drugs or drugs metabolized by CYP450_3A4
exclusion_criterion4: exposure to KW_6002 before or other investigational drug within two months

Title: The placebo effect on resting tremor in Parkinson's disease: an electrophysiological study
aims: Assess effects of placebo on resting tremor
description: Administration of a. placebo and b. apomorphine sc., tremor assessment after 30 and 60 minutes
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to diagnostic criteria as defined by Jankovic et al.
inclusion_criterion2: resting tremor with item 20 of UPDRS more than 2 for at least one hand during physical examination
inclusion_criterion3: damage to the nigrostriatal dopaminergic system on DAT-SPECT imaging
exclusion_criterion1: cognitive impairment with an MMSE score of less than 24
exclusion_criterion5: evidence of brain tumor, marked atrophy, and/or diffuse white matter hyperintensities on MRI
exclusion_criterion7: general exclusion criteria for MRI scanning.

Title: Effect of Cabergoline on Parkinsonian Tremor Assessed by Long-Term-Actigraphy
aims: Study anti-tremulous effect of cabergoline; validate long-term actigraphy
description: baseline period of 3 days, initial dosage of 0,5mg cabergoline on day 4, titration phase of 1mg increase per week, two weeks maintenance, clinical visits after three and six weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: moderate to marked rest tremor at one arm (item 20 UPDRS larger than 2)
exclusion_criterion1: anticholinergics, budipine or dopamine agonists in current pre-medication
exclusion_criterion2: contraindications against dopamine agonists or ergotamine derivates

Title: Clozapine in Parkinson's disease tremor. Effects of acute and chronic administration.
aims: To evaluate the effects of acute clozapine administration on parkinsonian mixed tremor, to establish the predictive value for long-term response and to determine differences in pharmacologic response of resting and postural tremor
description: all antiparkinsonian medication was withdrawn twelve hours before. Administration of a 12.5mg single dose of a. clozapine or b. placebo. UPDRS at baseline and at ten minute intervals for to hours. 15 iPS-patients with more than 50 percent improvement included in chronic, open-phase study for 15.5 months.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: presence of resting and postural tremor poorly responsive to levodopa

Title: Comparative Study of Selegiline Plus L-Dopa-Carbidopa Versus L-Dopa-Carbidopa Alone in the Treatment of Parkinson's Disease
aims: To evaluate the effects of selegiline as add-on to levodopa and carbidopa vs. the effect of levodopa and carbidopa alone
description: subjects in both groups randomly matched by computer for age, years of iPS at disease onset and years of treatment. Both groups under levodopa and carbidopa therapy. Patients assessed at regular intervals and rated clinically
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: continued use and add-on of levodopa-carbidopa later

Title: A placebo-controlled evaluation of ropinirole, a novel D2 agonist, as sole dopaminergic therapy in Parkinson's disease.
aims: To evaluate the effects and the safety of ropinirole on iPS-patients
description: Randomisation to a. ropinirole or b. placebo on a 2:1 ratio. Dosage of study medication was increased at .5 steps to a maximal dosage of 5mg bid, with dosages being adjusted at the discretion of the investigator, e.g., if side effects appeared
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stages between 1 and 4
exclusion_criterion2: patients with abnormalities in their medical history, physical examination or diagnostic testing that were deemed to be clinically significant

Title: Zuranolone as an oral adjunct to treatment of Parkinsonian tremor: A phase 2, open-label study.
aims: Explore effects of zuranolone on iPS-tremor as an add-on therapy
description: Treatmenr with oral zuranolone 20 or 30mg qd for 7 days
inclusion_criterion1: iPD defined by unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: tremor sum score MDS-UPDRS greater than 7
inclusion_criterion3: tremor motor score greater than 2 on one limb in ON medication state

Title: Safinamide as Add-On Therapy to Levodopa in Mid-to Late-Stage Parkinson’s Disease Fluctuating Patients: Post hoc Analysesof Studies 016 and SETTLE
aims: To evaluate the clinical effects of safinamide on motor fluctuations and cardinal symptoms of iPS-patients
description: study 116: two doses of safinamide (50 and 100) used in two groups  (for post hoc analyses 100 mg included only, Study SETTLE 50 mg daily for 2 weeks, afterwards 100 mg Safinamide. For post hoc analyses treatment effects of safinamide 100 mg once daily versus placebo  during double-blind phases of Stidy 016 and SETTLE. Data of both studies were pooled. 487 received 100 mg safinamide, 484 placebo.
inclusion_criterion1: mid to late-stage PD

Title: The effect of long-term levodopa therapy on depression level in de novo patients with Parkinson’s disease.
aims: To evaluate the effects of levodopa therapy on depression in de novo patients and additionally motor scores
description: NA
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to clinical criteria of the Core Assessment Program for Intracerebral Transplantation
exclusion_criterion1: Patients with structural lesions in the MRI
exclusion_criterion2: less than 24 points in the Mini Mental State Examination

Title: Could Apomorphine be an effective treatment option for refractory tremor in Parkinsons disease: a pilot study
aims: To evaluate effects of apomorphine sc as an add-on for levodopa refractory tremor in iPS
description: Apomorphine was administered at increasing dosages with 1, 2, 4mg every 15 minutes in OFF medication state
inclusion_criterion1: IPS-patients according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Controlled Pilot Study of the Effects of Neuromuscular Therapy in Patients with Parkinson's Disease
aims: To evaluate the effects of neuromuscular therapy on motor symptoms of iPS-patients
description: Randomisation to a. group receiving NMT and b. active control group receiving music relaxation. Two 45 minutes sessions weekly for four weeks. Identical relaxation music during all sessions. Data collection at baseline, week 4 and 8 days after finishing treatment
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: optimal and stable medication for at least one month
inclusion_criterion4: no expected medication changes within four months
inclusion_criterion6: no major active medical or psychiatric conditions

Title: Cerebral differences between dopamine-resistant and dopamine-responsive Parkinson’s tremor
aims: To ascertain increased tremor-related activity in non-dopaminergic brain regions, particularly the cerebellum in patients suffering from iPS with good response to dopaminergic therapy versus those without
description: Administration of  a. levodopa or placebo (200mg).
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: resting tremor that is MDS-UPDRS item 17 greater than 0 at least at one limb
exclusion_criterion6: improvement of less than 0,2 after levodopa in akinesia and rigidity MDS-UPDRS subscores

Title: Direct switch from levodopa/benserazide or levodopa/carbidopa to levodopa/carbidopa/entacapone in Parkinson’s disease patients with wearing-off: efficacy, safety and feasibility—an open-label, 6-week study.
aims:
To investigate the efficacy, safety and feasibility of direct switch from
either levodopa and carbidopa or levodopa and benserazide to levodopa with carbidopa and entacapone in study design resembling routine
clinical practice in iPS-patients with wearing-off
description: during baseline period of two weeks change in dosage between levodopa with decarboxlase inhibitor to lce with the possibility to adjust for dosage during this time. During six weeks period the medication had to remain unchanged
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stage of 1 to 3
inclusion_criterion4: wearing-off, defined as more than one positive symptom in the WOQ9 questionnaire
inclusion_criterion5: treatment with standard release levodopa and decarboxylase inhibitor at dosing frequency of three or four daily dosages
exclusion_criterion1: intake of COMT inhibitor six weeks prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion2: concomitant treatment with non-selective MAO inhibitor
exclusion_criterion4: concomitant medication with drugs with anti-dopaminergic action, such as reserpine, antipsychotics drugs if it did not exceed one evening dose of atypical antipsychotic drug
exclusion_criterion5: medication with D2 receptor blocking antiemetics, except domperidone
exclusion_criterion6: patients with unpredictable OFF periods or dyskinesia
exclusion_criterion9: females who were of childbearing potential, pregnant or lactating

Title: Rasagiline adjunct therapy in patients with Parkinson's disease: Post hoc analyses of the PRESTO and LARGO trials
aims: assess clinical effect of rasagiline 1mg/day on cardinal PD symptoms and motor fluctuations in defined patient subgrous using data from PRESTO and LARGO.
description: Post-hoc analysis of effects of rasagiline as add-on to existing dopaminergic therapy. Data of two studies (LARGO and PRESTO) pooled with analyses of all cardinal symptoms but also subgroup analyses
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: disease duration of less than 1.5 years from diagnosis
inclusion_criterion3: No necessity for anti parkinsonian treatment and forseable stable situation for nine months
inclusion_criterion4: willingness and ability to give informed consent
exclusion_criterion1: Subjects aged less than 30 or more than 80 years
exclusion_criterion3: UPDRS Tremor scores of three or greater in any limb
exclusion_criterion4: Hoehn and Yahr stage three or greater
exclusion_criterion6: subjects with history repeated strokes with stepwise progression of parkinsonian features, repeated head injury or history of definite encephalitis , sustained remission, presence of supranuclear gaze palsy, cerebellar signs, concomitant early severe autonomic involvement, presence of Babinski's sign, presence of a cerebral tumour or communicating hydrocephalus, MPTP exposure, Oculogyric crises
exclusion_criterion7: subjects who have had previous use of rasagiline or selegiline, subjects trated with other anti-PD medication at any time prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion8: subjects having used any other anti-PD medication (including anticholinergics) for less than three weeks prior to the three month period preceding baseline whose anti-PD medication is intentionally ceased in order for the subject to enter the study
exclusion_criterion9: subjects who have a clinically significant or unstable medical or surgical condition that may preclude safe and complete participation
exclusion_criterion10: Hypertensive subjects whose BP is not well controlled according to the medical record or as observed during the week of home BP recording prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion11: subjects diagnosed with melanoma based on the screening dermatologic examination, or with a history of melanoma
exclusion_criterion12: subjects with suspicious lesions at baseline who do not undergo biopsy
exclusion_criterion13: subjects with significant cognitive impairment as defined by MMSE score < 26
exclusion_criterion14: subjects with clinically significant psychiatric illness, including major depression [Beck Depression Inventory (short form) =15
exclusion_criterion15: subjects with a history of alcohol or substance abuse within the past 2 years
exclusion_criterion16: subjects who have taken any experimental medications within 60 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion17: subjects who have used coenzyme Q10 (in daily doses > 300 mg) within 120 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion18: subjects who have used sympathomimetics (including over-the-counter remedies - nasal or oral), dextromethorphan, pethidine or St. John's Wort within the 7 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion19: Subjects who have used antidepressants within 42 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion20: subjects who have used ciprofloxacin, a potent CYP 1A2 inhibitor within 7 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion21: subjects who have used MAO inhibitors including reserpine or methyldopa within the three months prior to baseline, or treatment with an anti-emetic or antipsychotic medication with central dopamine antagonist activity within the six months prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion22: women who are not postmenopausal, surgically sterilized, or using adequate birth control [oral birth control pills, IUD, or a long acting injectable form of contraception
exclusion_criterion23: barrier methods alone (i.e., condom) are not sufficient]. Women of childbearing potential without a negative pregnancy test at screening. Nursing women

Title: Piribedil as an adjunct to levodopa in advanced Parkinson's disease: the Asian experience.
aims: To report experiences with piribedil as adjunct therapy to levodopa in Filipino patients with advanced iPS
description: After baseline evaluation at week 0, start of piribedil treatment 50mg qd, slow increase of 50mg per week, evaluation after final week with UPDRS.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to Queens Square Brain Bank criteria
exclusion_criterion4: history of significant cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, psychiatric disease
exclusion_criterion6: history of neuroleptics intake except clozapine

Title: Treatment of parkinsonian tremor with clozapine.
aims: To assess the therapeutic efficacy of clozapine on parkinsonian tremor
description: previous medication with antichoinergics or beta-blockers discontinued, clozapine started at 25qd, stepwise increase until improvement or side effects occured. Clinical examinations twice before start and at days 3,7,10,17 and 21 during titration period and 30 and 90 during follow up
inclusion_criterion1: severe PD tremor w/o satisfying response to conventional therapy

Title: Effectiveness of an intensive rehabilitation treatment on different Parkinson's disease subtypes
aims: To evaluate whether different iPS-subtypes respond differently to physical excercise
description: four week cycle of physiotherapy with three daily sessions of one hour a. cardiovascular warm up, b. relaxation excercise c. muscle stretching, d. improving function of abdominal and sine muscles, e. secondary balance and gait excercise with stabilometric platform with visual cue and treadmill f. third occupational therapy for autonomy in daily iving activities). Examination by neurologists during OFF, i.e. after 12 hours medication withdrawal at baseline and at end of rehab treatment.
inclusion_criterion1: clinically probable iPS according to criteria by Gelb et al.
inclusion_criterion2: ability to walk without any physical assistanc
inclusion_criterion5: no vestibular or visual dysfunction limiting locomotion or balance
inclusion_criterion6: stable antiparkinsonian medications stable for more than 8 weeks

Title: Benztropine versus clozapine for the treatment of tremor in Parkinson's disease
aims: To compare low-dose clozapine to benztropine for treatment of tremor in iPS
description: clozapine and benztropine repackaged into identical capsules. Tremor measured by UPDRS and Fahn-Tolosa-Marin tremor scale at baseline and every two weeks. Videotapes at baseline and at maximum dose. a. Benztropine first 0.75mg qd increased each week by 0.75 mg to twice daily regimen. b. Clozapine first 12.5mg qd, increased by 12.5mg to twice daily regimen. Maximum doses of a. 4.5mg benztropine or 75mg clozapine daily. Ceiling dose for 1 week and maximum duration for each arm six weeks with two week washout. Second arm with other drug (clozapine or benzperidine, respectively)
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion4: score greater than 1 in UPDRS tremor items
exclusion_criterion6: dopamine blocking drugs within three months of study entry
exclusion_criterion9: concomitant medication with dopamine agonists, anticholinergics, amantadine or antihistamines
exclusion_criterion10: other drugs associated wih agranulocytosis within preceeding four weeks
exclusion_criterion11: significant adverse events with either anticholingergics or clozapine
exclusion_criterion12: white blood count of less than 4000 per microliter

Title: Low Dose Clozapine for the treatment of drug-induced psychosis in Parkinson's disease
aims: To evaluate effects of low-dose clozapine for treatment of drug-induced psychosis and motor functions of iPS-patients
description: Patients randomly assigned to a. clozapine or b. placebo, double blind evaluation for four weeks. Baseline physical examination. Clozapine started at 6.25mg qd, which could be increased once between weekly office visits. At end of fourth week all tests repeated. Possible doses of clozapine between from 6.25mg to 50mg qd
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to clinical criteria, that is when three of four cardinal symptoms were present
inclusion_criterion2: psychosis induced by antiparkinsonian drugs which were severe enough to require treatment
inclusion_criterion3: duration of psychosis more than four weeks
exclusion_criterion2: dopamine-blocking medication within three months before study
exclusion_criterion3: neuroleptic drug adminstered as depot within one year before study
exclusion_criterion4: change in anxiolytic or antidepressant medication within one month before study

Title: High Dose Treatment of Parkinson's disease with alpha-Dihydroergocryptine
aims: NA
description: individual dose of dihidroergocriptin as add-on to levodopa over 6 months
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: clinical decision to initiate or increase dosage of dihydroergocriptin

Title: Objective changes in motor function during placebo treatment in PD
aims: examine frequency, temporal development and stability of objectively derived motor changes during placebo treatment in iPS-patients and to define clinical domains and demographic groups most affected
description: Placebo treated group from randomized, multicentre, controlled clinical trial of monotherapy with ropinirole in iPS-patients without motor fluctuations. In 105 patients placebo-associated effects on motor parts of UPDRS was evaluated. Motor examination was divided into 4 categories: remor, bradykinesia, rigidity, gait and balance and midline function. Definition of placebo-associated improvement as improvement over baseline in motor UPDRS of at least .5 or a change in at least two motor itemts at any visits by more than two points.
inclusion_criterion1: early iPS according due unspecified clincal criteria
inclusion_criterion3: motor symptoms of sufficient severity to warrant the introduction of dopaminergic therapy, but not received L-dopa or any dopaminergic agonist for more than 6 weeks prior to study entry
inclusion_criterion4: other antiparkinsonian therapies, except selegiline, discontinued at least 4 weeks prior to study entry
inclusion_criterion5: selegiline were required to remain on a stable dose of selegiline for 4 weeks prior to study entry and for the duration of the study.
exclusion_criterion1: treatment with vasodilators, antiarrhythmics, digoxin, calcium channel blockers, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, or other antihypertensive agents (excluding diuretics)
exclusion_criterion3: history of severe systemic disease, major psychosis, or signs of dementia
exclusion_criterion4: history of severe dizziness or fainting
exclusion_criterion5: diastolic blood pressure of less than 110mmHg
exclusion_criterion6: recent history of alcoholism or drug dependence.

Title: The effects of whole body vibration on motor symptoms in Parkinson's Disease
aims: To study the effects of whole-body-vibration on motor symptoms in iPS
description: Levodopa withdrawn for 12hours. Three successive test sessions with two patients at each session in parallel, cross-over design. a. whole body vibration with consecutive resting phase. b. first rest, than whole body vibration. UPDRS motor score at baseline and after treatments . Examiner was blinded for intervention. Whole body vibration with 5 series lasting one minute, frequency of 6Hz and amplitude of 3mm.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
exclusion_criterion2: disease impairing gait, stance or coordination

Title: Parkinson's Diease Multimodal Complex Treatment (PD-MCT): Analysis of Therapeutic effects and Predictors for Improvement
aims: assess efficacy of PD-MCT and calculate predictors of improvement
description: Baseline assessment before start of training, Discharge clinical testing after two weeks and follow-up after 6 weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
exclusion_criterion1: inability to take part in procedures

Title: Rasagiline monotherapy in early Parkinson's disease: A phase 3, randomized study in Japan.
aims: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of rasagiline as monoherapy in iPS-patients
description: After initial two-week single-blind run-in period, in which patients received placebo once daily, a 26-week double-blind treatment period was conducted which patients were randomized 1:1 to receive a. placebo or b. oral rasagiline 1 mg qd
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stages of 1 to 3
exclusion_criterion1: Any investigational drug within prior 90 days
exclusion_criterion4: treatment with amantadine or an anticholinergic drug for more than 180 days
exclusion_criterion5: treatment with selegiline, levodopa or dopamine agonists for more 90 days
exclusion_criterion6: use of selegiline within 90 days of first visit, or of any medication containing levodopa, dopamine agonists, amantadine or anticholinergic drugs within 30 days of first visit

Title: Selegiline in the treatment of daily fluctuations in disability of parkinsonian patients with long- term levodopa treatment
aims: investigate the efficacy of selegiline in the treatment of various types of fluctuations in disability and the effect of selegiline on parkinsonian disability and on the daily levodopa dose needed
description: patients were randomized to receive a. selegiline hydrochloride or b. placebo. One tablet of 5.0mg was administered in the morning and the other at lunch time, whereas daily levodopa dosages were kept at pre-study levels as fat as possible. Yet, changes were allowed if parkinsonian disability or side-effects required
inclusion_criterion1: advanced iPS according to unknown diagnostic criteria
inclusion_criterion3: daily frequency of over six administrations of levodopa
exclusion_criterion2: diseases influencing the absorption of medications
exclusion_criterion3: allergies to the medications under investigation
exclusion_criterion4: previous treatments with selegiline or dopamine agonist

Title: Effect of subcutaneous apomorphine on tremor in idiopathic Parkinson's disease
aims: Evaluate the extent of tremor suppression under apomorphine therapy
description: After one week of domperidon treatment, medication was withdraw at least 12h. Apomorphine sc was administered at increasing dosage of1, 2, and 4mg. Assessment with UPDRS part III before apomorphine administration and 15 minutes after.
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Role of Matrabasti and Kapikacchu Beeeja Powder in Kampavata (Parkinson's Disease)
Journal: International Journal of Research in Ayurveda and Pharmacy
aims: To evaluate the effects of Mahamasha oil Matra (Enema) and Kapikacchu beeja (Mucuna pruriens seed) in Kampavata (iPS)
description: Haritaki powder 10-15gm with lukewarm water at bed time before treatment, full body massage with bala oil followed by 15 min steam bath.  Mahamasha oil Matrabasti (enema) 70ml every day for nine days, Mucuna pruriens seeds powder 6gm tid with lukewarm water after meals for 48 days. Evaluation before treatment, on ninth day after completion of enema course and after completion of oral treatment at day 48
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
exclusion_criterion1: other systemic disorders and with other complications possibly interfering with treatment

Title: Apomorphine in the Diagnosis and Treatment of Parkinsonian Tremor
aims: To compare the responses of rest tremor to single dose apomorphine and oral levodopa in 20 tremor-dominant IPS-patients
description: Antiparkinsonian medication paused for 12h, domperidone pre-treatment, first day afterwards 250mg levodopa with 25mg carbidopa. Second day apomorphine sc in 1.5, 3, 4.5mg doses at 30min intervals until tremor was supressed, dose limiting sight-effects were resported or maximum dose was achieved.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria with tremor dominance

Title: Preliminary study of zonisamide monotherapy in de novo patients with Parkinsons's disease
aims: evaluate therapeutic effects of zonisamide monotherapy in early Parkinson's disease patients
description: 10 untreated patients (de novo) patients were given 25 mg Zonisamide daily for 1 month, 50 mg in month 2 and 3. UPDRS I-IV and tremor-related UPDRS (items 16 (II) ,20, 21(III)) examined every month.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS accordint to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: no previous treatment with anti-parkinsonian medication

Title: Symptomatic efficacy of rasagiline monotherapy in early Parkinson's disease: Post-hoc analyses from the ADAGIO trial
aims: To analyse the efficacy of 1mg rasagiline monotherapy in early iPS
description: Patients randomised to 4 groups: a. 1mg rasagiline qd, b. 2 mg rasagiline qd, c. and d. delayed start with placebo respectively. Double-blind placebo-controlled phase for 36 weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to clinical diagnosis with at least two of the symptoms bradykinesia, tremor, rigidity without any other known or suspected cause of parkinsonism
inclusion_criterion2: unilateral onset and persistent asymmetry If tremor is not present
inclusion_criterion3: stable clinical condition not requiring anti-PD treatment for the next 9 months
exclusion_criterion1: Age younger than 30 or older than 80 years
exclusion_criterion3: UPDRS Tremor score of 3 or greater in any limb
exclusion_criterion4: Hoehn &Yahr Stage III or greater at screening
exclusion_criterion6: features that tend to exclude PD as the cause of Parkinsonism (repeated strokes or head injurys, definite encephalitis, Sustained remission, Supranuclear gaze palsy, Cerebellar signs, Early severe autonomic involvement, Babinski's sign, cerebral tumour or communicating hydrocephalus, MPTP exposure)
exclusion_criterion8: previous use of rasagiline or selegiline
exclusion_criterion9: other anti-PD medication at any time prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion10: clinically significant or unstable medical or surgical condition
exclusion_criterion13: significant cognitive impairment as defined by MMSE score < 26
exclusion_criterion16: history of alcohol or substance abuse within the past 2 years
exclusion_criterion17: experimental medications within 60 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion18: Q10 (in daily doses > 300 mg) within 120 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion19: sympathomimetics (including over-the-counter remedies - nasal or oral), dextromethorphan, pethidine or St. John's Wort within the 7 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion20: antidepressants within 42 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion21: ciprofloxacin, a potent CYP 1A2 inhibitor within 7 days prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion22: MAO inhibitors including reserpine or methyldopa within the three months prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion23: treatment with an anti-emetic or antipsychotic medication with central dopamine antagonist activity within the six months prior to baseline
exclusion_criterion24: women who are not postmenopausal, surgically sterilized, or using adequate birth control [oral birth control pills, IUD, or a long acting injectable form of contraception, barrier methods alone (i.e., condom) are not sufficient]
exclusion_criterion25: women of childbearing potential without a negative pregnancy test at screening

Title: Clozapine in the treatment of tremor in Parkinson's Disease
aims: To evaluate antitremor effects of clozapine as add-on therapy for iPS-patients
description: Clozapine aditionally to usual antiparkinson medication. Starting dose 6.25mg qd, if necessary increase each third day with dose split to bid. Study duration of six months with evaluations every fortnight. Every 4 weeks UPDRS motor evaluation. Changes of other parkinson medication during study were not allowed.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: troublesome tremor despite optimal antiparkinsonian treatment
exclusion_criterion1: dementia with MMST less than 18 points

Title: Exploring the effect of electrical muscle stimulation as a novel treatment of intractable tremor in Parkinson's disease
aims: To determine the efficacy of electrical muscle stimulation as a treatment for drug resistant tremor in iPS-patients
description: Hand tremor at rest and during postural positions assessed with the tremor analysis device which resulted in tremor parameters such as peak magnitude, the root mean square of angular velocity, frequency, and the dispersion of tremor a. before and b. during EMS. EMS was administered with parameters determined by slowly raising pulse amplitudes until tetanic muscle contraction occurred without pain. Stimulation lasted 10secs.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: medically refractory type I tremor according to the MDS consensus paper
inclusion_criterion3: irreponsiveness of tremor to more than two different medications
exclusion_criterion1: history of cardiac arrthythmia seizures or cerebral ischaemia
exclusion_criterion3: concomitant medication potentiating or attenuating tremor, including antihistamines, thyroid hormones, benzodiazepines, anticonvulsants, and illicit drugs
exclusion_criterion4: subjects with implanted electrical devices, such as cardiac pacemaker, deep brain stimulation devices and intrathecal baclofen pumps

Title: Rasagilin im klinischen Alltag - Ergebnisse einer Anwendungsbeobachtung bei Parkinson-Patienten mit einer Kombinationstherapie
aims: investigate efficacy and tolerability of rasagiline under conditions of daily living
description: iPS-patients received 1mg rasagilin qd as add-on for four months. Clinical evaluation at beginning, after four weeks and after four months. Concomitant parkinsonian medication remained unaltered.
inclusion_criterion1: NA

Title: Effect of eccentric-based rehabilitation on hand tremor intensity in Parkinson disease
aims: evaluate Effect of eccentric-based rehabilitation on hand tremor intensity in iPS
description: Moderate eccentric training three days per week for six weeks with 35-45min per session and assisted by occupational therapist. Targets were elbow flexor, wrist flexor and extensors muscle groups. Each muscle group trained with three sets of 10 repetitions of eccentric contraction with 1-2min rest between sets.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: visible hand tremor uni- or bilterally
exclusion_criterion2: lack of ability to complete excercise sessions

Title: Stochastic resonance therapy in Parkinson's disease
aims: To assess the effects of stochastic whole body vibration
description: Patients were randomly assigned to sham or experimental group. a. experimental group received 5 cycles of stochastic WBV on three days within five days. Cycle of five stimulus trains of 60s duration with a frequency of 6.5Hz and 60s resting time in between. b. control group received sham treatments with 1Hz (lowest frequency available).
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Short-term effects of vibration therapy on motor impairments in Parkinson's disease
aims: To evaluate the influence of vibration on motor symptoms and functional measures in iPS by delivering sound waves to the whole body
description: Vibrations applied by physioacoustic method. Arm chair run by software produced controlled sound vibrations from six speakers for whole body involvement in effect. Adminstered in 5 consecutive series lasting one minute each, one minute rest in between. Assessment by UPDRS first. Two participants studied in parallel, one first vibration, other one started with rest in single-blind cross-over design.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Adjuvant Therapy of Parkinsonian tremor
aims: To study the effects of propranolole, primidone and clonazepam ass add-on therapy for iPS tremor
description: Patients received either a. 80mg  qd for 1 week and 160mg afterwards, b. primidone 50mg qd for 1 week, 125mg for another week and 250mg qd afterwards), or c. clonazepam 1mg qd at first week and increase of 1mg weekly up to 4mg qd. Tremor evaluated after highest dose intake for one month.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: A double-blind crossover, placebo-controlled study of the adenosine A2A antagonist theophylline in Parkinson's disease
aims: To test for the effects of stable plama levels of theophylline on the long-duration response and the short-duration response to levodopa in advanced iPS-patients
description: Treatment for 15 days with a. 150mg theophylline bid and b. placebo bid; dosage was adjusted according to plasmatic levels during first week. After 15 days levodopa washout (but not theophylline or placebo) for four days and, finally, levodopa challenge was performed.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: treatment with levodopa as only medication at least two months before entering the trial

Title: Comparison of lisuride and bromocriptine in the treatment of advanced Parkinson’s disease
aims: Compare therapeutic efficacy of lisuride with bromocriptine
description: a. lisuride and placebo or b. bromocriptine and placebo as add-on therapy to levodopa or anticholinergics was administered. Patients randomly assigned to groups and optimal dosage found within 4-8 weeks. Therapy continued for further four weeks. After wash-out period of max 2 weeks, each group received the other drug and placebo.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: long-term levodopa treatment and motor fluctuations

Title: Effect of dopamine agonist pramipexole (mirapex) on tremor, affective disorders and quality of life in patients with Parkinson’s disease
Journal: Zh Nevrol Psikhiatr Im SS Korsakova
aims: To evaluate the effects of pramipexole on motor symptoms in iPS-patients
description: six months pramipexole therapy as add-on or monotherapy. Individual dose based on clinical impression
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
exclusion_criterion3: short psychological status scale scores of less than 25

Title: Rasagiline treatment effects on parkinsonian tremor
aims: To present data illustrating effect of rasagiline on tremor in iPS-patients with data from four the ADAGIO study
description: Two phases of trial each of 36 weeks duration. Randomisation to four groups, either with delayed-onset or immediate start of rasagiline. Only 1mg arm along with two placebo groups is compared. Specifically, patients received a. placebo or b. rasagiline 1mg qd for 36 weeks and consecutively both groups rasagiline. No other medication was allowed according to the protocol
inclusion_criterion1: iPS patients with at least two cardinal motor symptoms
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stage of three or less
exclusion_criterion1: Concomitant medication with any antiparkinsonian medication for more than three weeks
exclusion_criterion2: medication with rasagiline or selegiline at any dose or medication with coenzyme Q10 with more than 300mg daily in the previous 120 days
exclusion_criterion4: disease duration of more than 18 months

Title: Rasagiline treatment effects on parkinsonian tremor
aims: To present data illustrating effect of rasagiline on tremor in iPS-patients with data from four the TEMPO study
description: Patients received a. placebo or b. rasagiline 1mg qd. After one week of titration study could be increased to 2mg (data not included). Outcomes were assessed after further 25 weeks. No changes in medication were allowed according to the protocol
inclusion_criterion1: iPS patients with at least two cardinal motor symptoms
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stage of three or less
exclusion_criterion2: unstable medical problems including congestive heart failure of New York Heart Association class II or greater
exclusion_criterion3: psychiatric conditions that compromise the ability to give informed consent
exclusion_criterion4: subjects with significant cognitive impairment as defined by MMSE score < 23
exclusion_criterion6: subjects treated with levodopa, dopamine agonists, selegiline or amantadine
exclusion_criterion7: Concomitant medication with antidepressants except for  amitryptiline, paroxetine, sertraline, fluovoxamine or trazodone

Title: Acupuncture modulates the Cerebello-Thalamo-Cortical Circuit and Cognitive Brain Regions in Patiens of Parkinson's Disease with Tremor
aims: To investigate the effects of acupuncture on tremor in iPS-patients
description: Patients randomly assigned to a, true acupuncture group - TAG,  b. sham acupuncture group - SAG or c. waiting group - WG. a. stainless steel needles inserted for 2.0-3.0cm into DU2, that is Baihui, GB20, that is Fengchi and Chorea-Tremor Controlled Zone. Reinforcing reducing method performed every 10min. within 30min needle retention time. b. Needles next to above named points inserted, no manipulation to needle performed. c. 12 weeks medication only, afterwards true accupuncture.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: tremor at rest in at least one upper or lower extremity (item 20 in the UPDRS)
exclusion_criterion3: advanced iPS, that is Hoehn and Yahr stages of more than 4
exclusion_criterion4: age less than 45 or greater than 80 years
exclusion_criterion5: history of other neurological disorders or head trauma

Title: Clinical evaluation of pramipexole in advanced Parkinson's disease: Results of a double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study.
aims: To compare the efficacy, safety and tolerability of pramipexole to placebo in advanced iPS with motor fluctuations under levodopa
description: At first visit every recording of concomitant medication. At visit two randomization to a. pramipexole or b. matching placebo. Up to seven weeks ascending dose phase during which pramipexole was titrated from 0.375mg to 4.5mg tid. Dosage increased incrementally until stabile clinical examination or AE. Dose of levodopa and carbidopa could be reduced if possible. Maintenance dose phase up to 24 weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion5: stable levodopa dosage for at least 30 days
exclusion_criterion3: second- or third-degree AV block or SSS
exclusion_criterion6:
myocardial infarction within 6 months of the 
study
exclusion_criterion7: clinically significant liver or renal disease

Title: Cannabis (medical marijuana) treatment for motor and non-motor symptoms of Parkinson disease: an open-label observational study
aims: NA
description: Patients tested in OFF before taking their regular medication. UPDRS was rated among others tests ans questionnaires. Afterwards smoking of regular dosis cannabis with measurements repeated 30 minutes later by two raters
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: permission to smoke cannabis from Israel Minstry of Health as add-on therapy because of insufficient iPS medication or to treat combat pain
inclusion_criterion3: treatment with cannabis on daily basis for at least two motnhs

Title: Effects of Relaxation Training and Music in Parkinson's Disease
aims: To compare the effects of progressive muscle relaxation (PMR) and listening to music on motor symptoms in iPS-patients
description: Patients randomly assigned to two groups, a. Five sessions of Progressive Muscle Relaxation or b. five sessions listening to "Kleine Nachtmusik" for twenty minutes on five consecutive days. Tremor assessment with the "tremormeter"
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
exclusion_criterion1: Hoehn and Yahr stage greater than 4
exclusion_criterion2: severe depression or other psychiatric disorder
exclusion_criterion3: experience with relaxation techniques before study inclusion

Title: Zonisamide in the early stage of Parkinson's disease.
aims: investigate effects of zonisamide on the early stages of iPS
description: After first evaluation patients received 25mg zonisamid qd. Visited after 4, 12, 20 and 28 weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: disease duration of less than 3 years
inclusion_criterion3: levodopa and decarboxylase inhibotor only or only small amounts of dopamine agonists

Title: Alpha-dihydroergocryptine in the Long-term Therapy of Parkinson’s Disease
aims: To investigate the safety of alpha-DHEC
description: patients received alpha-DHEC over six months, initial dose 10mg qd, increased up to median dose of 30mg qd. at first three months or 40 mg month 4 to 6 qd.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Monotherapy of Parkinson's disease with budipine: A randomized double-blind comparision to amantadine.
aims: To compare budipine and amantadine with respect to efficacy and safety in monotherapy of mildly to moderately affected iPS-patients
description: Patients randomly assigned to a. budipine or b. amantadine. Evaluation by Webster-Rating-Scale after 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8 and 12 weeks. Bradykinesia, rigidity and tremor separately analysed.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Long-term efficacy of controlled-release carbidopa/levodopa in patients with advanced Parkinson's disease.
aims: To observe the long-term effects of controlled-release levodopa on motor symptoms of iPS-patients
description: Controlled-release levodopa at individual dosage and scheme was administered and changes were assessed after 12 months. Adjustments of other medication was allowed
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: continued use of extended release levodopa formulation after participation in previous RCT

Title: Piribedil Therapy in Parkinson's Disease Use of the Drug in the Retard Form
aims: evaluate the efficacy of piribedil in iPS-patients
description: previous antiparkinsonian medication including levodopa, anticholinergics and amantadine remained stable. Over 20 weeks pirbedil was administered starting with 50mg in cr formulation, weekly increment of 50mg up to maxmum of 200mg daily. Weekly examinations during first month, afterwards monthly
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Pergolide in the treatment of Parkinson's Disease
aims: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of pergolide for iPS-patients
description: NA
inclusion_criterion1: NA

Title: Pergolide in the treatment of Parkinson's Disease
aims: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of pergolide for the treatment of iPS-patients
description: Short-term double-blind study: 345 Patients randomly assigned to a. pergolide or b. bromocriptin. Up to day 14 fixed amount of either pergolide or bromcriptin. maintenance dosage thereafter determined for individual patient.

Title: A randomized double-blind placebo-controlled phase III trial of selegiline monotherapy for early parkinson disease
aims: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of selegiline monotheray in patients with iPS
description: Subjects were randomised to a. placebo or b. oral selegline. At first two weeks 1 mg qd was administered, at weeks 2-3 2.5mg bid, week 4-5 5mg in the morning and 2.5mg in the afternoon and from week 6 onwards 5mf bid
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to clinical diagnosis according to Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: motor symptoms for less than five years
inclusion_criterion4: hoehn and yahr stage of 1 to 3
inclusion_criterion5: no therapy with antiparkinson agents or less than 12 weeks of treatment
inclusion_criterion6: updrs scores of ten or greater
exclusion_criterion1: Treatment with pethidine, tramadol, tricyclic antidepressants, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors
exclusion_criterion2: certain antihistaminic drugs or drugs possibly affecting PD symptoms within three weeks before first medication intake
exclusion_criterion3: patients suffereing from concomitant impaired consciousness, hallucinations, delusions and abnormal disorders
exclusion_criterion5: patients with serious complications, e.g., cardiovascular, renal, hepatic or hematologic disorders
exclusion_criterion6: patients with past or current abuse of central nervous system stimulants such as antihypnotic drugs or cocaine

Title: Long-term Efficacy and Safety of Pramipexole in Advanced Parkinson's Disease: Results From a European Multicenter Trial
aims: To compare the efficacy, safety and tolerability of pramipexole compared to placebo in advanced iPS-patients
description: 30 days before randomization washout of dopamine agonists, iPS-patients randomized to a. pramipexole and b. placebo. Ascending dose phase of seven weeks, maitenance phase of up to 24 weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: advanced iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: presence of motor fluctuations under levodopa treatment as end-of-dose phenomena

Title: A Randomized, Double-Blind Study of a Skin Patch of a Dopaminergic Agonist, Piribedil, in Parkinson’s Disease
aims: to evaluate the pharmacologic activity of one and two transdermal patches of piribedil in combination with L-dopa on the motor symptoms of iPS
description: Transdermal patches with 30-cm2 matrices containing 50mg micronized piribedil and an adhesive strip were used, wheras placebo was of matching appearance. Two patches were applied daily at the same time on the dorsal surface of the arm, one below the other, on alternating arms at each application. If a patch became unstuck over more than half its area before the scheduled removal time, a replacement patch was applied to the same site. During the selection period, patients were treated for seven days with two placebo patches. At inclusion, randomization into three parallel treatment groups: a. two piribedil patches, b. two placebo patches, or c. one piribedil and one placebo patch.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion4: disease duration of less than 10 years
inclusion_criterion5: medication with levodopa for at least six months at dosages of more than 800mg qd divided into less than six dosages
inclusion_criterion6: levodopa regime unchanged for at least one month before inclusion
inclusion_criterion7: unchanged motor status and mood over two weeks before entering the study in terms of both Hoehn and Yahr stage and investigator impression
inclusion_criterion8: inadequate clinical response to current therapies as shown by persistent parkinsonian symptoms
exclusion_criterion3: systemic diseases as revealed by medical or laboratory examination
exclusion_criterion4: patients whose placebo patches failed to stick during the selection period
exclusion_criterion5: previous treatment with dopamine agonists if not withdrawn at least one month before enrolment
exclusion_criterion6: therapy with anticholinergics and selegiline initiated  less than one month before study enrolment
exclusion_criterion7: changes of dopamine agonist dosage during the trial

Title: Treatment of Parkinson’s disease with controlled release levodopa/carbidopa: An open observational trial
aims: To describe the effects of levodopa and carbidopa in an extended release formulation
description: Administration of levodopa and carbidopa in a controlled release formulation at individually accepted dosages.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Intravenous amantadine sulphate application improves the performance of complex but not simple motor tasks in patients with Parkinson’s disease

description: three infusions of 200mg amantadine sulphate on three consecutive days, assessment at day four
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: A nationwide collaborative study on the long-term effects of bromocriptine in patients with parkinson’s disease: The fourth interim report

inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: start on bromocriptine or already on medication thereof

Title: Double-blind, single dose, cross-over study of the effects of pramipexole, Pergolide, and Placebo on Rest Tremor and UPDRS part III in Parkinson's Disease
aims: To compare the effects of single oral dose of a. pramipexole b. pergolide or c. placebo on parkinsonian tremor and part III of the UPDRS
description: Three study days with one week in between. All participants received domperidone 24 hours before start of trial treatment, whereas no anti-parkinsonian medication were allowed from midnight onwards before the study. After baseline assessment, intake of 500 µg of pramipexole or pergolide, respectively or one pill of placebo. Assessment on half-hourly intervals for four hours with double-blind protocol.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank Criteria
inclusion_criterion2: rest tremor of at least one upper limb with an intensity of at least 2 of 10
inclusion_criterion3: no previous intake of direct acting dopamine agonist

aims: compare effects of single oral dose of a. pramipexole b. pergolide or c. placebo on parkinsonian tremor and part III of the UPDRS
description: Three study days with one week in between. After baseline assessment, intake of 500 µg of pramipexole or pergolide, respectively or one pill of placebo. Assessment on half-hourly intervals for four hours with double-blind protocol.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank Criteria
inclusion_criterion2: rest tremor of at least one upper limb with an intensity of at least 2 of 10

Title: Randomized, Double-blind, 3-Month Parallel Study of the Effects of Pramipexole, Pergolide, and Placebo on Parkinsonian Tremor
aims: To compare anti-tremor effects of pramipexole, pergolide and plaebo in iPS-patients
description: iPS-patients (n=30) randomly assigned to a. pramipexole b. pergolide or c. placebo. Pre-Treatment with domperidone and after baseline assessment dose gradually titrated upward in 9 levels that is placebo or 1.5mg pramipexole or 1.5mg pergolide tid. Monthly assessment including verbal fluency task while tremor was scored and measured.
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to UK Brain Bank Criteria
inclusion_criterion2: symptomatic tremor in at leasrt one upper limb with severitiy on validated tremor rating scale of more than two of ten
inclusion_criterion3: no previous medication with direct acting dopamine agonist

Title: Apomorphine-induced reorganization of striato-frontal connectivity in patients with tremor-dominant Parkinson’s disease
aims: To assess the acute effects of apomorphine versus placebo on tremor and functional connectivity
description: Subjects received a. 1mg apomorphine i.v. and b. placebo i.v. within two days after medication withdrawal in a cross-over and randomised design. Measurement 60 minutes after administration
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: rest tremor of more than 2 points in the UPDRS

Title: Efficacy and safety of rotigotine in elderly patients with Parkinson's disease in comparison with the non-elderly: a post-hoc analysis of randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trials
aims: To examine the efficacy and safety of rotigotine treatment for elderly and non-elderly PD patients separately
description: After a four week screening period, there was an eight week titration period and a four week maintenance period, a two week taper period, and, finally, a one week safety follow-up period. Patients received either a. rotigotine transdermal patches with 2 mg/24 hours or b. placebo patches. Weekly increments of 2mg up to a maximum of 16 mg qd during titration period.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stages I to III
exclusion_criterion1: Presence of psychiatric symptoms such as confusion, hallucinations, delusions, excitation, delirium and abnormal behavior
exclusion_criterion4: complications or history of serious cardiac disease and or arrhythmia
exclusion_criterion8: treatment with levodopa for more than 6 months by the time of informed consent
exclusion_criterion9: concomitant treatment with substances that could possibly affect PD symptoms from at least four weeks before the date of first treatment

Title: Efficacy and safety of rotigotine in elderly patients with Parkinson's disease in comparison with the non-elderly: a post-hoc analysis of randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trials
aims: To examine the efficacy and safety of rotigotine treatment for elderly and non-elderly PD patients separately
description: post hoc analysis of all randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trials with focus on rotigotine in Japan. Two combination-therapy trials (levodopa plus rotigotine vs levodopa + placebo) included.
inclusion_criterion1: NA

Title: Effects of methylphenidate on response to oral levodopa: a double-blind clinical trial
aims: Confirm beneficial effects of pramipexole on core symptoms of iPS with focus on tremor; assess antidepressant effects of pramipexole; demonstrate practicability of Snaith-Hamilton-Pleasure Scale, Tremor impact scale and Short Parkinson's Evaluation Scale
description: Admission to inpatient stay for four days, during which dosage was titrated to .4mg per kg tid, while other medication was reduced if possible. Subjects returned to two visits after one and two weeks during which the efficacy was tested. Comparisons between measurements at 8am and 8pm. Randomisation to a. methylphenydate and b. placebo
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: normal vital signs and general medical history and examination

inclusion_criterion1: parkinsonism

Title: Pramipexole in Levodopa-treated Parkinson Disease Patients of African, Asian, and Hispanic Heritage
aims: To evaluate the tolerability, safety, and efficacy of pramipexole in iPS-patients who identified themselves as members of any of three US census designations: African, Hispanic, or Asian.
description: a. pramipexole or b. identical appearing placebo was initiated at 0.375mg qd and escalated during first six weeks to a maximal dosage of 4.5mg or until occurence of intolerable side-effects. Medication was administered t.i.d, with subjects receiving 0.375 mg daily during weeks 1 and 2, 1.5mg daily during weeks 3 and 4, 3.0mg daily during week 5, and 4.5 mg from week 6 onwards. In case of side-effects, dosage was decreased temporarily to the prior tolerable level, and titration was resumed to the maximally tolerated dosage. Subjects were maintained at final dosage for four week maintenance period. If disabling parkinsonism developed during maintenance, levodopa dosage was adjusted.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: subjects self-identified as being of African, Hispanic, or Asian heritage
inclusion_criterion4: treatment with stable dosage of levodopa for at least one month before randomization
exclusion_criterion2: Mini Mental State Examination of less than 21
exclusion_criterion4: occurrence of a seizure within year before screening
exclusion_criterion5: clinically significant hepatic or renal disease
exclusion_criterion6: clinically significant coronary artery disease, bradycardia, or congestive heart failure
exclusion_criterion7: myocardial infarction within six months of randomization
exclusion_criterion10: medication with dopamine agonist within two months before inclusion
exclusion_criterion11: use of unstable dose of CNS active therapies 60 days before randomization

Title: Efficacy of oral administration of licorice as an adjunct therapy on improving the symptoms of patients with Parkinson’s disease, A randomized double blinded clinical trial
aims: To investiate the effects of liquorice on symptoms of iPS-patients

inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Pramipexole in patients with Parkinson's disease and marked drug resistant tremor: a randomised, double blind, placebo controlled multicentre study
aims: To compare the tremorlytic properties of pramipexole to those of placebo as add-on medication in iPS-patients
description: two weeks screening period, random assignment to a. Placebo or b. pramipexole under double blind conditions, ascending dose interval of seven weeks to 0.375 and 4,5mg qd pramipexole or matching placebo, four weeks maintenance period, one week dosis reduction. Additional antiparkinsonian medication stable 30 days before randomisation and during study.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: marked and drug resistant tremor defined by sum of 6 at one side or 8 on both sides in items 16,20 and 21 of UPDRS

aims: investigate effects of single dose of levodopa on rest state connectivity in MEG and on EMG tremor characterstics
