Title: Effective management of upper limb parkinsonian tremor by incobotulinumtoxin-A injections using sensor-based biomechanical patterns
aims: evaluate safety and efficacy of kinematically-guided, indivldualized incobotulinumtoxin  A injections for upper limb tremor in iPS- and ET-patients
description: EMG-guided individualized injections of incobotulinum toxin into unilateral arm  after kinematic tremor assessment with sensors at wrists, elbows and shoulders; four injections every 12 weeks, mean dose approximately 150U
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: Hoehn and Yahr stages from 1 to 3
inclusion_criterion3: stable medication for at least six months
inclusion_criterion4: no previous treatments with botulinum toxin

Title: Two weeks of treatment with deprenyl (selegiline) does not prolong L-dopa effect in parkinsonian patients: A double-blind cross-over placebo-controlled trial
aims: To determine whether deprenyl can improve clinical effects of a single standard dose of levodopa, and whether two weeks of deprenyl treatment could improve parkinsonian patients motor scores
description: a. selegiline 10mg daily or b. placebo in a controlled double-blind cross-over design for two successive periods of two weeks each.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: treatment with levodopa at a stable dosage for at least two months before entering the trial
inclusion_criterion3: levodopa medication had to remain unchanged during the study
inclusion_criterion4: other antiparkinsonian drugs were allowed if their dosages remained stable for the same period.

Title: [Pramipexole in Parkinson disease Results of a treatment observation]
aims: To observe the efficacy and safety of pramipexole in clinical practice
description: pramipexole in individualized daily dosage of up to 3.15mg qd over nine weeks with unaltered dosage within last five weeks
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Pramipexole in Routine Clinical Practice. A Prospective Observational Trial in Parkinson's Disease.
aims: To confirm the beneficial effects of pramipexole on core symptoms of iPS with focus on tremor, to assess antidepressant effects of pramipexole and to demonstrate the practicability of the Snaith-Hamilton-Pleasure Scale, Tremor impact scale and Short Parkinson's Evaluation Scale
description: Treatment details from 298 German centres and 657 iPS-patients. Tretament with pramipexole initiated by local neurologist with 0,35mg td, increased weekly up to 4,5mg over 4 weeks. Clinical evaluation at baseline, at end of titration phase and at end of observation.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: [Practical experience on improving activities of daily living competence in Parkinson’s patients treated with ropinirole Results of a applied study]
aims: Observe efficacy and safety of ropinirole in iPS-patients
description: Individualised dosage of ropinirole was increased up to 24mg qd over twelve weeks. Stable dosage within last six weeks of observation
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown criteria

Title: Efficacy and tolerability of rasagiline in daily clinical use - A post-marketing observational study in patients with Parkinson’s disease
aims: observe the efficacy and tolerability of rasagiline as mono and combination therapy in large population of iPS-patients
description: Administration of rasagiline 1mg qd as monotherapy or as add-on therapy
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Active-assisted cycling improves tremor and bradykinesia in Parkinson’s disease
aims: To investigate effects of a single session of active assisted cycling on tremor and bradykinesia of iPS-patients
description: Subjects were compared at baseline and after half an hour active assisted cycling using a motomed with 75rpm and subjects being asked to pedal 80-85 rpm. Recordings in OFF medication state
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Activity and acceptability of piribedil in Parkinson's disease: a multicentre study
aims: To determine the efficacy of piribedil as monotherapy in iPS-patients
description: Multicentre trial of three months duration; otherwise untreated patients received piribedil, start dosage of 50mg qd, up-titrated to 150-250mg qd
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: either tremor-dominance or presence of all cardinal symptoms of iPS
inclusion_criterion3: rest tremor equal to or greater than 1 on Webster scale
exclusion_criterion5: treatment with monoaminoxidase A or B inhibitors
exclusion_criterion6: intake of neuroleptics or previous treamtent with piribedil

Title: Effect of tens over parkinson‘s disease tremor.
aims: To explore the symptomatic effects of tens on iPS-patients' tremor
description: NA
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Comparison of effectiveness of trihexyphenidyl and levodopa on motor symptoms in Parkinson's disease.
aims: To compare the responsiveness of motor signs to a single fixed dose of trihexphenidyl and levodopa and to compare relative tremor improvement
description: Overnight medication withdrawal, consecutively 4mg THP over 48 hours. Then, again, overnight medication withdrawal and administration of 200 and 50mg levodopa and carbidopa, respectively
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to MDS diagnostic criteria
inclusion_criterion2: current or previous medication with trihexphenidyl

Title: Long-term tremor therapy for Parkinson and essential tremor with sensor-guided botulinum toxin type A injections
aims: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of kinematically-guided, individualised incobotulinumtoxin A injections for upper limb tremor in iPS-patients
description: EMG-guided individualized injections of incobotox into unlateral arm mm. after kinematic tremor assessment with sensors at wrists, elbows and shoulders, injections every 12 weeks, mean dose approx. 150 U
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion4: stable medication for at least six months
exclusion_criterion1: history of stroke or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
exclusion_criterion4: concomitant medication with lithium, valproate, steroids, amoidarone, beta-adrenergic agonists or zonisamide
exclusion_criterion5: history of allergic reactions to botulinum toxin

Title: Standardized algorithm for muscle selection and dosing of botulinum toxin for Parkinson tremor using kinematic analysis
aims: To investigate rge effects of incobotulinumA injections on tremor of iPS-patients
description: EMG-guided individualized injections of incobotox into arm, uni- or bilaterally after kinematic tremor assessment with sensors at wrists, elbows and shoulders. Four injections every 12 weeks, mean dose approximately 150U
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Parkinson’s Disease Tremor is Diminished with Relaxation Guided Imagery
aims: To assess the effects of relaxation guided imaginary and relaxing music on tremor
description: In a two hour session, all participants received a. relaxation guided imagery b. self relaxation period and c. relaxing music. Besides, a baseline period was recorded
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: rest tremor of at least 3 on item 20 of the UPDRS

Title: Parkinson’s Disease Tremor is Diminished with Relaxation Guided Imagery
aims: To assess the effects of relaxation guided imaginary and relaxing music on tremor
description: In a two hour session, all participants received a. relaxation guided imagery b. self relaxation period and c. relaxing music. Besides, a baseline period was recorded
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: rest tremor of at least 3 on item 20 of the UPDRS

Title: Parkinson’s Disease Tremor is Diminished with Relaxation Guided Imagery
aims: To assess the effects of relaxation guided imaginary and relaxing music on tremor
description: In a two hour session, all participants received a. relaxation guided imagery b. self relaxation period and c. relaxing music. Besides, a baseline period was recorded
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: rest tremor of at least 3 on item 20 of the UPDRS

Title: Qigong exercise for the symptoms of Parkinson’s disease: A randomized, controlled pilot study
aims: To investigate the effects of Qigong on iPS-symptoms
description: two courses of weekly 60 minutes sessions of qigong for eights weeks with eight weeks break inbetween versus no intervention
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
exclusion_criterion2: changes in medication during previous month before before study
exclusion_criterion3: signs of other central nervous system disease
exclusion_criterion4: dementia with MMSE of less than 24

Title: Parkinson’s disease improved function with GM1 ganglioside treatment in a randomized placebo-controlled study
aims: To study the effects of GM1-ganglioside injections on motor symptoms of iPS-patients
description: Allocation to a. GM1-ganglioside or b. placebo group. At entrance, baseline characteristics were evaluated and all subjects received information on how to perform the administration. 1000mg of active substance solved in 50ml saline solution or only saline solution were administered. Afterwards, subjects were instructed to inject themselves 100 mg GM1-ganglioside daily bid versus placebo over 16 weeks
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: age between 40 and 80, Hoehn and Yahr stages 1 to 3
exclusion_criterion6: women who were not under birth control

Title: Reduction of parkinsonian signs in patients with Parkinson’s disease by dopaminergic versus anticholinergic single-dose challenges
aims: To investigate the effects of single-dose apomorpine or biperiden on tremor, rigidity and bradykinesia in iPS-patients
description: a. single-dose of subcutanous apomorphine individual dosage determined beforehand, requiring 25 percent UPDRS III reduction or b. 5mg biperiden iv. in off med state
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria with tremor
exclusion_criterion1: medical conditions likely to be exacerbated by any of the drugs

Title: Ropinirole for the treatment of tremor in early Parkinson's disease
aims: To analyse the effects of ropinirole on tremor in iPS-patients
description:
All antiparkinsonian treatments, except selegiline, were discontinued at least 4 weeks prior to study entry. Patients were entered into seven day placebo run-in period to assess compliance. Patients who were at least 80% compliant
were allowed t o continue in the study. Subjects were stratified to a. ropinirole or b. placebo
inclusion_criterion1: early stage iPS
inclusion_criterion2: no levodopa premedication six weeks before inclusion
inclusion_criterion3: no dopaminergic medication for two weeks
inclusion_criterion4: stable other antiparkinsonian medication two weeks before inclusion
exclusion_criterion1: Treatment with vasodilators, antiarrhythmics, digoxin, calcium channel blockers, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, or other antihypertensive agents excluding diuretics
exclusion_criterion3: history of severe systemic disease, major psychosis, or signs of dementia
exclusion_criterion4: history of severe dizziness or fainting
exclusion_criterion5: diastolic blood pressure of less thsn 110mmHg
exclusion_criterion6: recent history of alcoholism or drug dependence

Title: Ropinirole for the treatment of tremor in early Parkinson's disease
aims: To analyse the effects of ropinirole on tremor in iPS-patients
description: Randomization into two arms with either a. ropinirole and b. bromocriptine. Intake in blinded design td. initial dosages of 0.75 mg and 1.25 mg respectively was titrated upward at weekly intervals according to patients' response up to maximal 24mg ropinirole and 40mg bromocriptine. Levodopa with decarboxylase inhibitor could be used as adjunct medication if therapeutic response insufficient. Efficacy was assessed after 36 months
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stages I to III
inclusion_criterion4: no medication with levodopa or dopamine agonists, selegiline, amantanide or anticholinergics for longer than six weeks
exclusion_criterion1: subjects with additional severe systemic or psychiatric diseases
exclusion_criterion2: history of alcohol or drug dependence

Title: Ropinirole for the treatment of tremor in early Parkinson's disease
aims: To analyse the effects of ropinirole on tremor in iPS-patients
description: Randomisation to a. ropinirole or b. levodopa. Dosage of study medication were adjusted weekly. Ropinirole was initiated at 0.25mg tid and levodopa therapy at 50mg qd plus placebo twice daily. Maximal dosages were 8mg ropinirole tid  and 400mg levodopa tid. Patients without adequate symptom control despite highest tolerated dose, could be given supplementary levodopa. No other antiparkinsonian therapies were permitted after study initiation.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stages between 1 and 3)
inclusion_criterion5: Prior treatment with levodopa or dopamine agonists limited to a maximum of six weeks and discontinuation at least two weeks before entry into the study
exclusion_criterion1: Patients suffering from severe dizziness or fainting
exclusion_criterion7: treatment with monoamine oxidase inhibitor within two weeks before entry with the exception of selegiline

Title: Selegiline and levodopa in early or moderately advanced Parkinson’s disease: a double-blind controlled short- and long-term study
aims: To investigate the effects of selegiline as an add-on to levodopa in iPS-patients
description: a. selegiline 10mg qd. vs. b. placebo for eight weeks. Consecutively, four weeks washout followed by cross-over eight weeks.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: stable dosage of levodopa before entering the study

Title: Tremorlytic activity of budipine: A quantitative study with long-term tremor recordings
aims: To investigate the long-term effects of budipine as an add-on in tremor-dominant iPS
description: budipine as an add-on to regular dopaminergic therapy individualized dose, mean 58 mg (range 80,80), 10 surface EMG recording at baseline and after 3-5 months
inclusion_criterion1: iPS accordint to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Tremorlytic activity of budipine in Parkinson’s disease
aims: To investigate the effects of budipine as an add-on for tremor control in iPS
description: All subjects were treated with either a. bromocriptine 60 mg qd or b. placebo for four months, whith the full dose being reached after six weeks
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: constant dosages of levodopa and bromocriptine before inclusion
inclusion_criterion3: LEDD between 200 and 1000mg qd prior to inclusion

Title: A multi-center, randomized, vitamin E controlled and opening clinical trial of selegiline in patients with Parkinson's disease.
aims: To investigate the clinical efficacy and safety of selegiline as adjunctive treatment of iPS-patients
description: Patients were randomly assigned to a. oral administration of 5mg selegiline qd and vitamin E 100mg qd both of which were increased at second week to 10mg qd, and the vitamin 100 mg bid or b. administration of vitamin E 100mg qd and 200mg qd at second week. The other medication remianed unaltered
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: insufficient symptom control after former antiparkinsonian treatment
inclusion_criterion4: Hoehn and Yahr stages I to III
exclusion_criterion1: Exclusion of severe heart, lung, liver or kidney disease
exclusion_criterion2: concomitant treatment with serotonin reuptake inhibitors
exclusion_criterion3: medical history of recreational drug or alcohol abuse
exclusion_criterion5: concomitant psychosis or other central nervous system diseases

Title: Pramipexole safely replaces ergot dopamine agonists with either rapid or slow switching
aims: To investigate the efficacy and safety of switiching from ergot dopamine agonists to pramipexole
description: Switching from bromocriptine, cabergoline or pergolide to pramipexole either overnight or over a two week period in equivalent dosages; further dosage adjustment of pramipexole if needed up to 4.5mg qd
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
exclusion_criterion4: concomitant severe heart, kidney or liver dieases
exclusion_criterion5: necessity of long travels by car
exclusion_criterion6: working in height, hazardous daily activities

Title: Tremor in Parkinson disease: acute response to oral levodopa
aims: To investigate the acute tremorolytic effect of oral levodopa
description: patients with levodopa and carbidopa treatment discontinued anti-parkinsonian medication three weeks prior to study. Postural and rest tremor measured four hours after last habitual intake of levodopa and 45 minutes after administration of a single dose of levodopa and carbidopa or placebo. Accelerometric measurement of finger tremor on more affected side
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria

Title: Botulinum toxin a injections for the treatment of hand tremors
aims: To report effects of botulinumtoxin injections on tremor in iPS and essential tremor
description: EMG guided individualized botulinumtoxin injections with mean dosage of 107.5U. Muscles were wrist flexors and extensors in almost all patients, additionally other muscles possible. Booster injections after three weeks allowed
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: Hoehn and Yahr stage of less than 3

Title: Stepwise intravenous infusion of apomorphine to determine the therapeutic window in patients with Parkinson’s disease
aims: To characterize the dose-effect relation of apomorphine in iPS-patients
description: apomorphine infusion with stepwise increase of dosages every 20 minutes, starting at 10ug per kg per hour and maximum 100 ug per kg per hour, then stepwise decrease to baseline
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: stable medication for more than one month

Title: Effects of handwriting exercise on functional outcome in Parkinson disease: A randomized controlled trial
aims: To determine whether handwriting exercise improves writing skills and motor function of iPS-patients
description: handwriting exercises for four weeks vs. no intervention
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stage 1 to 3 on medication
inclusion_criterion4: stable medication for six weeks prior to study participation

Title: The efficacy of (+)-4-propyl-9-hydroxynaphthoxazine as adjunctive therapy in Parkinson’s disease
aims: Evaluate efficacy and safety of PHNO and Naxagolide in iPS-patients
description: four three-day treatment periods with PHNO in increasing dosages from 0.25 to 1mg with 4 day wash-out periods in between
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
exclusion_criterion1: intake of anticholinergics, dopamine agonists or amantadine within one week before enrollment

Title: Latency of re-emergent tremor in Parkinson's disease is influenced by levodopa
aims: Study effects of levodopa on amplitude of re-emergent tremor and on tremor pause duration
description: Acute levodopa challenge test after 12h to 24h medication withdrawal. Baseline tremor activity at rest and with stretched-out arms measured using an accelerometer. Administration of 250mg levodopa. Measurement repeated every 20min after medication until lowest motor score was registered.
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to MDS diagnostic criteria
inclusion_criterion2: presence of rest and re-emergent tremor
exclusion_criterion4: anatomic or orthopedic upper limb disorders

Title: Treatment of Essential and Parkinsonian Tremor with Nipradilol
aims: To investigate the efficacy and safety of nipradilol for treating tremor in 20 patient with essential tremor and 20 patients with iPS
description: Administration of 6mg nipradilol bid for 8 weeks, with no other beta-blockers within two weeks prior to study and during study. IPS medication unchanged during entire study.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria

Title: Cognitive Stress Reduces the Effect of Levodopa on Parkinson’s Resting Tremor
aims: To explore the acute effects of levodopa and cognitive stress on resting tremor in iPS-patients
description: All subjects received levodopa challenge in off-medication state with single dose of 200 of levodopa and 50mg of benserazide
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: rest tremor with amplitude greater than 0 at least at one upper extremity

Title: Dopamine-responsive and dopamine-resistant resting tremor in Parkinson disease.
aims: To explore the effects of supramaximal single dose of levodopa on resting tremor in iPS-patients
description: After overnight medication withdrawal, administration of single dose dispersible 200mg levodopa and benserazide. Measurement of MDS-UPDRS, accelerometry dorsal on one hand, tremor during rest and during cognitive coactivation
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion2: resting tremor that is MDS-UPDRS item 17 greater than 0 at least at one limb
exclusion_criterion6: improvement of less than 0,2 after levodopa in akinesia and rigidity MDS-UPDRS subscores

Title: Efficacy and safety of rasagiline as an adjunct to levodopa treatment in Chinese patients with Parkinson’s disease: A randomized, double-blind, parallel-controlled, multi-centre trial
aims: To investigate the effects of rasagiline as an add-on to levodopa in Chinese iPS-patients
description: Participants reveived either a. 1mg rasagiline qd  or b. placebo over 12 weeks. Assessments at baseline and after this period
inclusion_criterion1: IPS according to clinical diagnosis with at least two of the symptoms bradykinesia, tremor, rigidity
inclusion_criterion3: disease duration of less than 10 years
inclusion_criterion5: Hoehn and Yahr stage less than 5 in OFF medication state
exclusion_criterion1: medication with selegiline within last 60 days
exclusion_criterion2: medication with fluoxetine or fluvoxamine within last 35 days

Title: The efficacy of homemade tolcapone in the treatment of patients with parkinson’s disease
aims: To investigate the effects of homemade tolcapone on motor symptoms of iPS-patients
description: 26 weeks of 100 mg tolcapone as an add-on to levodopa td
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stage of less than 5 in the ON condition

Title: A randomized, double-blind, controlled trial of add-on therapy in moderate-to-severe Parkinson’s disease
aims: evaluate effects of droxidopa as add-on on motor symptoms and daily living in iPS-patients
description: 200 mg droxidopa td vs. placebo for 6 weeks
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stage greater than 3 in the ON condition
exclusion_criterion1: prior intake of COMT- or MAO-inhibitors

Title: DL-3-n-butylphthalide therapy for Parkinson’s disease: A randomized controlled trial
aims: investigate effects of DL-3-n-butylphthalide on motor symptoms, sleep and quality of life in iPS-patients
description: NBP 200mg td for 24 weeks as an add-on or monotherapy vs. no treatment
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to UK Brain Bank criteria
inclusion_criterion3: stable medication for 6 weeks or without prior medication
inclusion_criterion4: relative or friend willing to participate
exclusion_criterion1: gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory or cardiac disease

Title: Activité du piribédil dans la maladie de Parkinson.
aims: To investigate the effects of piribedil on levodopa-naive patients with Parkinson’s disease
description: Measurement at baseline and after three months by experienced neurologist and severeity scored by means of the Webster scale
inclusion_criterion1: iPS-patient according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: resting tremor present with a score of more than 1 on the Webster scale
inclusion_criterion3: Hoehn and Yahr stages between 1 and 3
exclusion_criterion2: recent cardiovascular diseases such as myocardial infarction or orthostatic dysfunction
exclusion_criterion5: treatment with neuroleptics or MAO-inhibitors or medication other than levodopa to treat symptoms before

Title: Efficacy of Piribedil as Early Combination to Levodopa in Patients with Stable Parkinson’s Disease: A 6-Month, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Study
aims: To demonstrate therapeutic benefits of piribedil, in comparison to placebo, as early add-on to levodopa.
description: administration of placebo during 15 days. Random assignment to a. piribedil plus levodopa or b. placebo plus levodopa. Medication was continued for six months. Starting dosage for medication was 50mg qd. , which was increased every two weeks at 50mg steps to 150mg tid. By the fifth week and up to 6 months, subjects received dosage achieved in the titration phase, whereas levodopa was kept stable until fourth month but could be adjusted afterwards if therapeutic efficacy was not maintained.
inclusion_criterion1: iPS according to unknown clinical criteria
inclusion_criterion2: disease duration of less than 10 years
inclusion_criterion5: previous therapy with dopamine agonists, anticholinergics, and amantadine discontinued for at least one month before screening
inclusion_criterion6: levodopa treatment for more than six months but less than eight years
inclusion_criterion7: residual parkinsonism on a stable dosage of levodopa between 150mg and 800mg qd
inclusion_criterion8: patients under treatment with selegiline could participate as long as they were on stable dosage more than one month before enrolment
exclusion_criterion1: Concomitant treatment with anxiolytics, hypnotics, and antidepressants except for MAO-inhibitors, amineptine, medifoxamine, fluoxetine, and fluphenazine with nortriptyline iff therapies remained unchanged throughout the trial
